title: Wind Cave National Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations        Candlelight Tour Sheena Harper   Â    Reservations Cave Tours Reservations are accepted for schools or large groups that would like to take part on any of the cave tour routes. Reservations are also strongly recommended for the Historic Candlelight Tour and are required for the Wild Cave Tour and may be made up to 30 days in advance of the tour. Groups need to make arrangements several weeks in advance. Call 605-745-4600 for group information or reservations.  Permits Backcountry Camping All backcountry campers must have a backcountry use permit in their possession. These free permits can be obtained at the visitor center information desk. Permits provide a measure of safety for backpackers in the event of an emergency as well as help park managers monitor potential impacts to sensitive resources. Other Permits Filming / Photography Permits - Information about special use photography and commercial filming at Wind Cave National Park. Special Use Permits - Information for those interested in holding special events or commercial uses of Wind Cave National Park.
